dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5393 IH: Southern Arizona Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gosar (for himself and Mr. Crane) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To nullify Presidential Proclamation 7320 and restrict the designation of national monuments in southern Arizona.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Southern Arizona Protection Act.

section.header: Restriction on use of antiquities act in certain areas in Arizona

subsection.text: Presidential Proclamation 7320 of June 9, 2000 (65 Fed. Reg. 37259, relating to the establishment of the Ironwood Forest National Monument), shall have no force of effect.

No extension or establishment of national monuments within the area generally depicted as Ironwood Forest National Monument on the map titled Ironwood Forest National Monument and dated June 12, 2000, may be undertaken except by express authorization of Congress.
